content: this pattern was reverse-engineered from a set of booties my grandma stadler made in the 80 s my aunt her daughter suffers from diabetes and requested that i make her more booties like the ones grandma made which keep her feet warm and accommodate swelling these are female adult-sized with very forgiving fitting **yarn ** worsted weight about 200 yards **needles ** size 8 5mm in both straight and double-pointed **notions ** 2 stitch markers **gauge ** 4 5 stitches per inch you knit the cuff and heel flat then join in the round for the foot and toe the cuff folds down so it is reverse stockinette then i-cord laces are knit separately
